p: Thirteen dogs died (72%) of which 11 died of local tumour progression. One each died from GI bleeding and renal carcinoma. Two dogs had a second surgery following relapse. At the time of data submission, three dogs were still alive at 900, 723 and 141 days and two dogs were lost to follow up 564 and 856 days after surgery. Overall median survival time was 893 days. There was no significant difference between the survival outcomes according to carcinoma or sarcoma diagnoses.
